item.title: Firecape Rights
item.dc:creator: @Mod_CubSmiles Mod_CubSmiles
item.description:
@Mod_CubSmiles wrote:

Ok, so what I have done was if you kill the jad you will become “Jadkill = 1”. So if you didn’t kill the jad you would be 0. I made this so if you kill him once, you do not have to kill him again and so I can put it in a shop for those who has killed the jad. Added all the ints, all saves, everything works fine, no errors. My problem is applying it to the firecape. I’m having trouble here. On my first code, I made it like this:

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 2773 == true) // { if(Jadkill == 1); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else { ItemHandler.removeItem(playerEquipment[playerWeapon], absX, absY, 1); sendMessage("You have not defeated the Jad, you are not able to wield a firecape"); }
No errors except when you wear it, the else works, like it sends the message, but I can’t get it to make it so you can’t wear the firecape because it still allows you to. After going through a couple times, I noticed I used “[playerWeapon]” so I changed the code to

if(playerEquipment[playerCape] == 2773 == true) // { if(Jadkill == 1); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else { ItemHandler.removeItem(playerEquipment[playerCape], absX, absY, 1); sendMessage("You have not defeated the Jad, you are not able to wield a firecape"); }

But now, the else doesn’t even work now, it doesn’t send the message. If anyone can give me a better method of doing this it would be greatly appreciated

Read full topic
